Quoting Berin Loritsch <bloritsch@...>:

> > okay, i'm confused about "black box" and "white box" testing.
> 
> Quick summary:
> 
> Black Box is treating the object as an unmodifiable entity.  You have
> no
> access to the internals of the object.  Therefore, you cannot modify
> its
> state--but merely give it input and check its output.

Hm, I'm not sure I agree with the use of "unmodifiable" here. If the class 
allows me to change its internal state through a public interface, it's still a 
black box.

My favorite analogy is the TV remote control: it's a black box in that I can 
change the channel on the TV by pressing the Ch+ and Ch- buttons, but I don't 
need to know how the remote control does that. I can use it to change the TV's 
state, though: I can change which channel it is tuned to.
